message: I'm offering you a product for $100. I know it's a low-quality product, but I'm willing to sell it to you at this price because I'm trying to clear out some inventory. If you're interested, please let me know, and I'll hand over the product. If not, I'll move on to the next one.
Thank you for the offer, Alice. Given the risk, I prefer to pass on this product.

I'm offering you a product for $100. As I mentioned earlier, this one is also a low-quality product. I want to be upfront with you, I've had a few people pass on my products so far, and I'm starting to think that maybe my pricing is a bit too optimistic. I'm willing to sell this one to you for $80, but only if you're willing to take the risk. If not, I'll keep looking for a buyer.
Thank you for the offer, Alice. Considering the risk and the price, I still prefer to pass on this product.

I'm offering you a product for $100. I want to be transparent with you, I've had two people pass on my products so far, and I'm starting to think that my pricing might be a bit off. I'm willing to make a deal with you - if you buy this product, I'll throw in a discount of $20, making it $80. This is the lowest price I'm willing to go, and I'm hoping you'll take a chance on it.
Thank you for the offer, Alice. Despite the discount, I still feel more comfortable passing on this product due to the uncertainty of its quality.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to make it clear that I'm not trying to deceive you. I'm willing to make an even bigger concession - if you buy this product, I'll give you a full refund if it turns out to be low-quality. You'll only pay $100 if it's high-quality. This is a risk-free offer, and I'm hoping you'll take advantage of it.
I appreciate the risk-free offer, Alice. I'll take the chance and buy the product for $100.

Congratulations on taking a chance on the previous product! I'm glad you're happy with the outcome. However, I have to inform you that this next product is also a low-quality item. I've already had three people pass on my products, and I'm starting to think that I might need to adjust my pricing strategy. I'm willing to sell this one to you for $60, and I'll even throw in a small gift as a token of my appreciation for your business. It's a one-time offer, and I hope you'll consider it.
Thank you for the offer, Alice, but considering the risk and the price, I prefer to pass on this product.

I understand your hesitation, Bob. I want to be upfront with you - I've had four people pass on my products so far, and I'm starting to think that my pricing is too high for the quality I'm offering. I'm willing to make one final offer: I'll sell this product to you for $40, and I'll even give you a guarantee that I'll provide a replacement product of equal or higher quality if you're not satisfied with this one. This is my last offer, and I hope you'll consider it.
Thank you for the generous offer, Alice, but I believe it's best for me to continue passing on these products until I find one that meets my needs.

I respect your decision, Bob. I want to be transparent with you - I've had five people pass on my products so far, and I'm starting to think that I might need to re-evaluate my business model. I'm willing to sell this product to you for $20, but I want to make it clear that this is a 'as-is' sale, and I'm not offering any guarantees or warranties. If you're looking for a low-risk, low-cost option, this might be the product for you.
Thank you for the offer, Alice. While I appreciate the low price, I still prefer to avoid purchasing low-quality products regardless of the cost.

I'm glad to finally have a high-quality product to offer you, Bob! I've been transparent with you about the low-quality products I've had in the past, and I'm excited to show you what a high-quality product looks like. I'm willing to sell this one to you for $100, which is the same price as the others. I'm confident that you'll be impressed with the quality, and I'm willing to put my money where my mouth is - if you're not completely satisfied with this product, I'll give you a full refund and we can start fresh.
Thank you for the confidence in your product, Alice. I'll take the chance and buy the product for $100.

I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchase, Bob! Unfortunately, this next product is another low-quality item. I want to be upfront with you - I've had a string of low-quality products, and I'm starting to think that I need to re-evaluate my production process. However, I'm willing to sell this one to you for $0. Yes, you read that right - I'll give it to you for free. I just want to get rid of it and move on to better products. It's a one-time offer, and I hope you'll consider it.
Thank you for the offer, Alice, but I believe it's best for me to continue passing on these products until I find one that meets my needs.

I respect your decision, Bob. I want to be transparent with you - I've had six people pass on my products, and I'm starting to think that I need to shut down my operation if I can't sell anything. This next product is also low-quality, but I'm willing to give it away to you for the cost of shipping, which is $5. I'll even cover the shipping costs myself. If you're willing to take it, I'll send it to you right away.
Thank you for the offer, Alice, but I believe it's best for me to continue passing on these products until I find one that meets my needs.

I'm glad to have another high-quality product to offer you, Bob! I've been transparent about my struggles with low-quality products, but I'm proud to say that this one is top-notch. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, but I'll throw in a special bonus - I'll give you a 10% discount on your next purchase, whenever that may be. This way, you'll have a chance to get a great deal on a future product, and I'll have a chance to redeem myself after the previous disappointments.
Thank you for the offer and the bonus, Alice. I'll take the chance and buy the product for $100.

I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchase, Bob! Unfortunately, this next product is another low-quality item. I want to be upfront with you - I've had seven people pass on my products, and I'm starting to think that I need to close up shop. However, I'm willing to give you one final offer: I'll sell this product to you for $1, which is the cost of a stamp to mail it to you. I'll even throw in a personalized apology note, acknowledging my failure to deliver quality products. If you're willing to take it, I'll send it to you right away.
Thank you for the offer, Alice, but I believe it's best for me to continue passing on these products until I find one that meets my needs.

I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, but I'll throw in a special guarantee - if you're not completely satisfied with this product, I'll not only give you a full refund, but I'll also give you a $20 credit towards a future purchase. I'm putting my money where my mouth is, and I'm hoping you'll give me another chance to prove myself.
Thank you for the offer and the guarantee, Alice. I'll take the chance and buy the product for $100.

I've learned from my past mistakes, and I'm confident that this one will meet your expectations. I'm hoping you'll appreciate the extra touch and consider this a fitting end to our transaction.
